transcript: Prussia and our second war with Na- poleon was beginning, Anna Pavlovna gave one of her soirees. The "cream of really good soci- ety" consisted of the fascinating Hlne, for- saken by her husband, Mortemart, the delight- ful Prince Hippolyte who had just returned from Vienna, two diplomatists, the old aunt, a young man referred to in that drawing room as "a man of great merit" (un homme de beau- coup de mMte), a newly appointed maid of honor and her mother, and several other less noteworthy pe
